DOC.brief_summary: To investigate long-term effect cardiovascular mortality/morbidity renal failure type 1 diabetes patient former randomize intensive insulin treatment
DOC.brief_title: Long-term Effects Intensive Insulin Treatment Type 1 Diabetes
DOC.detailed_description: The Stockholm Diabetes Intervention Study ( SDIS ) aim determine whether intensified insulin treatment feasible lead less serious diabetic complication . 102 patient type 1 diabetes mellitus randomize ( October 1982 March 1984 ) intensify conventional treatment ( ICT ; n=48 ) standard treatment ( ST ; n=54 ) . The randomized SDIS study last 7.5 year , whereas 96 patient fully evaluate . Thereafter patient assign regular clinical visit . In present interventional study want study all-cause mortality cardiovascular outcome ( i.e . myocardial infarction stroke ) , renal failure SDIS cohort december 31 2011 .
DOC.criteria: Born 1930 later Type 1 diabetes Nonproliferative retinopathy Normal serum creatinine Unsatisfactory blood glucose control Alcohol/drug abuse Proliferative retinopathy
